intro: Tradescantia balbisii, commonly known as the wandering Jew, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a perennial herb with fleshy, oval-shaped leaves that are typically green or variegated with white or pink stripes. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, which are borne on slender stalks. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. Tradescantia balbisii is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of light conditions and its tolerance to indoor environments.
